stories.text: Within the last year there was a post about a terminal demonstration program which allowed you to create a file with comments in of the code/commands to type and would then open a new window and type the commands on another screen, in type with your button presses, to make it look like you are typing without making a mistake. My Googlefu is weak and I can't find any trace of it. Does anybody know what I am thinking of any where I can find it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Terminal Demonstration
The turbulent and uncertain future of AI
Individuation: Jung's Myth for Our Time
Ontarians are getting digital ID this fall: All you need to know

stories.text:
I've seen this book come up a lot over the years in tech circles and finance circles, even more so now with tech and finance seeming to merge together with cryptocurrency. I don't agree with every idea of Rand's but there are some very interesting parallels for sure.

I'm thinking about things like the world being angry at Facebook but when there is an outage, millions of people seem to be freaking out. Also the world having mixed feelings about Amazon and consumerism but when the world's shipping infrastructure is having issues, people realize how much they rely on e-commerce these days. Imagine if Big Tech just stopped working for a day, imagine the world's computing grid just going offline completely for even an hour.

I live in Maui and notice that a lot of tech billionaires and millionaires buy land or estates here. This is kind of a 'utopian paradise' in their eyes. The irony is that there is a lot of issues in Hawai'i that most tourists just aren't aware of.

I could write a lot more but I think you get the idea. I'm curious to hear what you think and feel. I know this is a loaded question but it's Saturday and this is the only place I know that would take a question like this seriously.

Thank you for reading and contributing
stories.title: Ask HN: Is the world today like 'Atlas Shrugged' to you? Why or why not?
